alert.note: Alert for Bonner (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 10:24PM MDT until June 14 at 7:02AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner and Boundary. Portions of Northeast Washington, including the following counties, Ferry, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in creeks and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 PM PDT, the public reported minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. An additional 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rain will be possible through midday Tuesday. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Colville, Chewelah, Newport, Ponderay, Moyie Springs, Kootenai, Dover, Clark Fork, East Hope, Nordman, Suncrest, Sherman Pass, Copeland, Ferry, Kettle Falls, Republic and Ione. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
